hold to something.translation[0].definit: if you hold to a belief, principle, promise etc, you believe it or behave according to it
He admitted he did not hold to the traditional view of God.
to make someone do what they have promised
‘I’ll ask him tomorrow.’ ‘OK, but I’m going to hold you to that.’
to prevent your opponent in a sports game from getting more than a particular number of points
Norway held Holland to a 2–2 draw.
